page.title: 17THATCHING
page.content: 'THATCHER' FREEMAN HAS LIVED IN EPWELL ALL HIS LIFE AND IS ONE OF THE MOST FAMOUS TRADITIONAL CRAFTSMEN IN THE AREA. HE BEGAN THATCHING ROOFS WHEN HE WAS 14 AND RICK THATCHING WHEN HE WAS 16. IT TAKES 30 DAYS TO COMPLETE ONE ROOF OF ABOUT 30 FEET AND THIS WOULD COST FROM Â£3-7000. IT IS WELL-PAID THOUGH SOMETIMES IT IS A VERY HARD JOB ESPECIALLY IN THE BAD WEATHER. HE ENJOYS HIS WORK WHEN HE IS THATCHING. HE USES SPECIAL MATERIALS OF REEDS FROM DEVON AND IF IT IS PROPERLY MAINTAINED A THATCHED ROOF WILL LAST FOR 45 YEARS (25 YEARS IF IT IS NEGLECTED). HE WAS VERY INTERESTING AND TALKATIVE AND HIS HOBBIES ARE DANCING, DOMINOES AND HE ALSO LIKES FOX-HUNTING. HE ALSO GETS INVOLVED IN PUBLIC WORK IN THE VILLAGE HALL. HE ALSO HAS HIS OWN FARM.
